briefdescription.para: Initializes a new instance of the ByteBuffer class. The intial buffer size is 0 bytes.
Initializes a new instance of the ByteBuffer class with the specified size. After initialization, the buffer is enlarged to the specified size.
The ByteBuffer's destructor. Free's the underlying buffer, and cleans up used resources.
Checks if the buffer is empty and returns true when the buffer is empty and false when the buffer is not empty.

simplesect.para: A boolean indicating whether the buffer is empty. True is returned when the buffer is empty and false when it is not.

briefdescription.para: Gets the size of the buffer. This is not the same as the data size.

simplesect.para: The size of the buffer, in bytes.

briefdescription.para: Gets the amount of bytes that can be read until the end of the buffer is reached.

simplesect.para: The amount of bytes that can be read until the end of the buffer is reached.

briefdescription.para: Gets the current position within the byte buffer. The position is the offset within the buffer that writing/reading starts at.

simplesect.para: The position within the byte buffer.

briefdescription.para: Sets the current position within the byte buffer. The position is the offset within the buffer that writing/reading starts at.

parameterdescription.para: The offset to set the current position to. The new offset must be 0 and not exceed the size of the buffer.

simplesect.para: A boolean indicating whether setting the position to the requested offset succeseeded. True is returned when the operation succeseeded and false is returned when the operation failed.

briefdescription.para: Increases the position by the specified amount of bytes.

parameterdescription.para: The amount of bytes to increase the position with, by default this is 1.

simplesect.para: A boolean indicating whether setting the position to the requested offset succeseeded. True is returned when the operation succeseeded and false is returned when the operation failed.

briefdescription.para: Decreases the position by the specified amount of bytes.

parameterdescription.para: The amount of bytes to decrease the position with, by default this is 1.

simplesect.para: A boolean indicating whether setting the position to the requested offset succeseeded. True is returned when the operation succeseeded and false is returned when the operation failed.

briefdescription.para: Sets the current position within the byte buffer. The position is the offset within the buffer that writing/reading starts at.

parameterdescription.para: The offset to set the current position to. The new offset must be 0 and not exceed the size of the buffer.

simplesect.para: A boolean indicating whether setting the position to the requested offset succeseeded. True is returned when the operation succeseeded and false is returned when the operation failed.

briefdescription.para: Assures that the buffer is of the specified size and enlarges the buffer when the current size of the buffer is below the specified, desired size.

parameterdescription.para: The desired size of the buffer.

briefdescription.para: Assures that the buffer is of the specified size and enlarges the buffer when the current size of the buffer is below the specified, desired size.

parameterdescription.para: The desired size of the buffer.

briefdescription.para: Writes the specified data of the specified size to the buffer. The buffer is automaticlly resized when the specified data does not fit into the current buffer.

simplesect.para: Increases the position by the specified size.

parameterdescription.para: The data to write to the buffer. If the specified data is NULL, no data will be written.
The size of the data to write.

briefdescription.para: Writes the specified data of the specified size to the buffer. The buffer is automaticlly resized when the specified data does not fit into the current buffer.

simplesect.para: Increases the position by the specified size.

parameterdescription.para: The data to write to the buffer. If the specified data is NULL, no data will be written.
The size of the data to write.

briefdescription.para: Writes the specified data of the specified size to the buffer. The buffer is automaticlly resized when the specified data does not fit into the current buffer.

simplesect.para: Increases the position by the specified size.

parameterdescription.para: The data to write to the buffer. If the specified data is NULL, no data will be written.
The size of the data to write.

briefdescription.para: Writes the specified data of the specified size to the buffer. The buffer is automaticlly resized when the specified data does not fit into the current buffer.

simplesect.para: Increases the position by the specified size.

parameterdescription.para: The data to write to the buffer. If the specified data is NULL, no data will be written.
The size of the data to write.

briefdescription.para: Writes the specified string to the buffer. The buffer is automaticlly resized when the specified string does not fit into the buffer.

simplesect.para: Increases the position by the size of the specified string.
Accounts for the string termination character (\0).

parameterdescription.para: The string to write to the buffer.

briefdescription.para: Writes the specified value to the buffer. The buffer is automaticlly resized when the specified value does not fit into the buffer.

simplesect.para: Increases the position by the size of the specified value.

parameterdescription.para: The value to write to the buffer.

briefdescription.para: Writes the specified value to the buffer. The buffer is automaticlly resized when the specified value does not fit into the buffer.

simplesect.para: Increases the position by the size of the specified value.

parameterdescription.para: The value to write to the buffer.

briefdescription.para: Writes the specified value to the buffer. The buffer is automaticlly resized when the specified value does not fit into the buffer.

simplesect.para: Increases the position by the size of the specified value.

parameterdescription.para: The value to write to the buffer.

briefdescription.para: Writes the specified value to the buffer. The buffer is automaticlly resized when the specified value does not fit into the buffer.

simplesect.para: Increases the position by the size of the specified value.

parameterdescription.para: The value to write to the buffer.

briefdescription.para: Writes the specified value to the buffer. The buffer is automaticlly resized when the specified value does not fit into the buffer.

simplesect.para: Increases the position by the size of the specified value.

parameterdescription.para: The value to write to the buffer.

briefdescription.para: Writes the specified value to the buffer. The buffer is automaticlly resized when the specified value does not fit into the buffer.

simplesect.para: Increases the position by the size of the specified value.

parameterdescription.para: The value to write to the buffer.

briefdescription.para: Reads the specified amount of bytes from the buffer and copies it into the specified buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to write to.
The amount of bytes to read from the buffer.

simplesect.para: A boolean indicating whether reading succeseeded. True is returned when reading succeseeded and false when reading failed.

briefdescription.para: Reads the specified amount of bytes from the buffer and copies it into the specified buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to write to.
The amount of bytes to read from the buffer.

simplesect.para: A boolean indicating whether reading succeseeded. True is returned when reading succeseeded and false when reading failed.

briefdescription.para: Reads all remaining bytes from the buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to write the acquired data to, make sure the buffer is at least the size of of the specified maximum size.
The maximum amount of bytes to copy into the specified buffer, the size of the specified buffer.

simplesect.para: A boolean indicating whether writing the remainging bytes to the specified buffer was a success.

briefdescription.para: Reads all remaining bytes from the buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to write the acquired data to, make sure the buffer is at least the size of of the specified maximum size.
The maximum amount of bytes to copy into the specified buffer, the size of the specified buffer.

simplesect.para: A boolean indicating whether writing the remainging bytes to the specified buffer was a success.

briefdescription.para: Reads an integer from the buffer.

simplesect.para: The integer that was read from the buffer. -1 is returned when reading failed.

briefdescription.para: Reads an unsigned integer from the buffer.

simplesect.para: The unsigned integer that was read from the buffer. 0 is returned when reading failed.

briefdescription.para: Reads a char from the buffer.

simplesect.para: The char that was read from the buffer. -1 is returned when reading failed.

briefdescription.para: Reads an unsigned char from the buffer.

simplesect.para: The unsigned char that was read from the buffer. 0 is returned when reading failed.

briefdescription.para: Reads a short from the buffer.

simplesect.para: The short that was read from the buffer. -1 is returned when reading failed.

briefdescription.para: Reads an unsigned short from the buffer.

simplesect.para: The unsigned short that was read from the buffer. 0 is returned when reading failed.

briefdescription.para: Attempts to read a string for the buffer until a string termination character, or the end of the buffer is encountered.

parameterdescription.para: Specifies the maximum length of the string being returned. Specifying zero disables this functionality.

simplesect.para: The string that was read, if something went wrong, or the end of the buffer was reached, everything that was read so far will be returned. If the buffer is empty, or there are no more bytes left to read, an empty string will be returned.

briefdescription.para: Reads the contents of the buffer from start to end and returns the contents as a string.

simplesect.para: This does not affect the current position.
The contents of the buffer as a string.

briefdescription.para: Dump everything from the current position to the standard output, where each byte in the buffer is dumped in it's hexadecimal representation. Each byte will be separated by a space and after 35 bytes, a new line is created.
A dynamiclly sized buffer for binary data. Resizes the underlying buffer when new data is written. Makes it easier to write to buffers that already contain data.

simplesect.para: Swen Kooij (Photonios)
